mittee might prefer B; and vice versa. If C, a white student with extraordinary
artistic talent, were also seeking one of the remaining places, his unique quality
might give him an edge over both A and B. Thus, the critical criteria are often in-
dividual qualities or experience not dependent upon race but sometimes associated
with it.(emphasis added)
This example further demonstrates the problematic nature of the LSA’s ad-
